nodes.bodyText: A "NullPointerException" could be thrown; "lookup" is nullable here.
Okay, as far as I understand the contract of Lookup is that lookup is supposed to return only one service impl. Thus, if we are expect there might be several executors here, then it makes sense.
Is that change for further features/bugfixes? Does it require to be covered by unit test, or it anyway will be covered in other PRs?

Since there is no unit test for lookup.lookup  there is no "replacement" for it.
All DevModeHandler  functionality is too hard to test: the design is very bad.
I'm not going to add any unit tests here.
